intro: Mesona clausa, commonly known as the Chinese bluebell, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Mesona clausa is often found in woodland edges and stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
